intro: Byrsonima cowanii, commonly known as the wild cherry or sour cherry, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine and culinary practices. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry forest and savanna habitats. The bark and leaves contain compounds with potential medicinal properties.
